column4: I suddenly can not access the network configuration dialog in breezy? anyone got any ideas?
anyone know that "lo" is on the network interfaces?
well something strange is happening....
ok i had my wifi configured ok
and i started up and it didnt work
so normally i go into configuration and disable it then activate it and 9 times out of 10 it works again
...i was getting this same issue with wired ethernet
anyway this time i start up i cant get to the configuration dialog
lo is 127.0.0.1 loopback
when you type lsconfig, what is the ip address you have for lo?
open terminal window
i done that
and what did it output?
try ifconfig then
did ifconfig output any other connections than lo?
and what are the ips for eth0 and  ath0
are you behind a router? are you sure static ip is correct wth correct gateway ip and dns server ips
you got something wrong in your routing tables
if you deactivate eth0 can you still access the internet with lo?
you only have one ip address assigned to eth0 correct.....try opening network with sudo or root
sudo network-admin
Dapper here
think I will just count my lucky stars that its working
